0.content:
Caption:
视频展示了关于一颗来自外太阳系的神秘天体的发现和分析过程。首先，通过太空望远镜的观测图像展示了一颗形状不规则的物体穿越星空的场景，并标注了它的轨道和路径。随后，视频展示了这颗物体在2017年11月的轨迹，以及科学家如何利用数据来研究它的运动。接着，屏幕上出现了文字解释该物体名为'Oumuamua，意为‘侦察兵或来自遥远过去的信使’。最后，一位女士站在宇宙背景前，解释了这一发现及其意义。
Transcript:
[0.40s -> 3.92s]  Do you remember hearing about that weird, strange-shaped object that passed through
[3.92s -> 6.32s]  our inner solar system late last year?
[6.32s -> 10.56s]  It was the first object we've confirmed to have come from outside our solar system, and
[10.56s -> 16.76s]  was given the name Oh Muamua, Hawaiian for Scout or Messenger from our distant past.
[16.76s -> 20.96s]  Now scientists have analyzed data from many observatories, including NASA's Hubble Space
[20.96s -> 27.44s]  telescope, and found that this interstellar object has gained an unexpected boost of speed.
[27.44s -> 30.00s]  After Oh Muamua was discovered with Hawaii's Pan Stars

metadata.chunk_summary: 视频展示了关于一颗来自外太阳系的神秘天体的发现和分析过程。首先，通过太空望远镜的观测图像展示了一颗形状不规则的物体穿越星空的场景，并标注了它的轨道和路径。随后，视频展示了这颗物体在2017年11月的轨迹，以及科学家如何利用数据来研究它的运动。接着，屏幕上出现了文字解释该物体名为'Oumuamua，意为‘侦察兵或来自遥远过去的信使’。最后，一位女士站在宇宙背景前，解释了这一发现及其意义。
metadata.notes: 视频结合了天文图像、文字说明和人物讲解，详细介绍了这一重要科学发现的过程和成果。

1.content:
Caption:
视频展示了多个天文观测场景，包括位于夏威夷的全景巡天望远镜和快速响应系统（Pan-STARRS），用于发现近地小行星。接着是一系列太空探测器和航天器在太空中捕捉彗星和小行星的图像，并讨论了这些观测对于了解小行星轨迹和性质的重要性。最后，一位讲解员在宇宙背景前讲述这些观测的结果和意义。
Transcript:
[0.00s -> 5.86s]  one telescope as it surveyed the skies for near-Earth asteroids in October 2017.
[5.86s -> 10.18s]  Observatories all around and above the world focused on this approximately half-mile-long
[10.18s -> 14.88s]  object to learn as much as possible about this cosmic visitor before it flew too far away
[14.88s -> 16.38s]  to sea.
[16.38s -> 20.32s]  The Hubble Space Telescope was used to collect observations to determine the object's
[20.32s -> 25.52s]  trajectory over two months in late 2017 and early 2018.
[25.52s -> 29.78s]  The observations were combined with data from multiple ground-based observatories, which
[29.78s -> 31.78s]  I'm sure.
1.transcript:

[29.78s -> 31.78s]  I'm sure.

metadata.chunk_summary: 视频展示了多个天文观测场景，包括位于夏威夷的全景巡天望远镜和快速响应系统（Pan-STARRS），用于发现近地小行星。接着是一系列太空探测器和航天器在太空中捕捉彗星和小行星的图像，并讨论了这些观测对于了解小行星轨迹和性质的重要性。最后，一位讲解员在宇宙背景前讲述这些观测的结果和意义。
metadata.notes: 视频从天文观测开始，展示了不同观测设备在不同环境中的应用，接着是详细的太空探测任务描述，最后以讲解员的讲解结束

2.content:
Caption:
视频中，一位身穿红色上衣的女士站在宇宙背景前，用手势强调其讲解的内容。接着展示了关于奥陌陌（1/2017 U1）的轨道和轨迹分析图示，以及它在太空中的动态模拟图像。随后是彗星67P的特写镜头，并附有相关文字说明。最后，视频回到女士继续她的讲解，背景依然是宇宙主题。整个视频内容涉及天体物理现象及观测研究。
Transcript:
[0.00s -> 6.02s]  showed Omuamua to have a small, continuous, non-gravitational acceleration.
[6.02s -> 10.06s]  Something besides just the gravity from the Sun and planets was affecting the trajectory
[10.06s -> 12.06s]  of Oh Muamua.
[12.06s -> 17.10s]  A probable source of this acceleration is jets of gas coming off the object.
[17.10s -> 21.10s]  This behavior is similar to objects we have already identified as comets.
[21.10s -> 25.82s]  When they get close to the Sun, Isis and the comets sublimate into gas and streamers of
[25.82s -> 28.98s]  gas can push the object along.
[28.98s -> 29.98s]  and comments do this.
2.transcript:
[0.00s -> 6.02s]  showed Omuamua to have a small, continuous, non-gravitational acceleration.
[6.02s -> 10.06s]  Something besides just the gravity from the Sun and planets was affecting the trajectory
[10.06s -> 12.06s]  of Oh Muamua.
[12.06s -> 17.10s]  A probable source of this acceleration is jets of gas coming off the object.
[17.10s -> 21.10s]  This behavior is similar to objects we have already identified as comets.
[21.10s -> 25.82s]  When they get close to the Sun, Isis and the comets sublimate into gas and streamers of
[25.82s -> 28.98s]  gas can push the object along.
[28.98s -> 29.98s]  and comments do this.

metadata.chunk_summary: 视频中，一位身穿红色上衣的女士站在宇宙背景前，用手势强调其讲解的内容。接着展示了关于奥陌陌（1/2017 U1）的轨道和轨迹分析图示，以及它在太空中的动态模拟图像。随后是彗星67P的特写镜头，并附有相关文字说明。最后，视频回到女士继续她的讲解，背景依然是宇宙主题。整个视频内容涉及天体物理现象及观测研究。
metadata.notes: 视频从一位讲解员开始，她站在宇宙背景前进行讲解，随后通过图表和图像展示具体天体运动和现象，最后再次回到讲解员继续讲解

3.content:
Caption:
视频中，一位身着红色上衣的女士站在宇宙背景前，通过手势和表情向观众讲解彗星和小行星的相关知识。她首先介绍了彗星的特征，如彗尾和彗核，并解释了这些现象是如何形成的。接着，视频展示了彗星 Hale-Bopp 的图像，强调了它的明亮彗尾。随后，视频讨论了被称为 'Oumuamua 的天体，指出它没有彗尾或尘埃云的现象。通过对比 Hubble 卫星拍摄的图像和艺术家对 'Oumuamua 可能具有尘埃尾巴的设想图，进一步解释了这种缺乏尘埃的原因。最后，视频展示了艺术家对小行星在太阳附近运行时的描绘，并通过女士的讲解来补充这些视觉内容。整个视频的背景是星空和宇宙的图案，增强了科学教育的主题。
Transcript:
[0.00s -> 5.30s]  the outgassing can be seen because it ejects large amounts of dust which form a cloud
[5.30s -> 9.06s]  around the object called a coma and a tail.
[9.06s -> 13.76s]  But with Omuamua, no type of coma or tail is seen.
[13.76s -> 18.24s]  Maybe Omuamua doesn't have much dust left after its intercellar journey, an amount no more
[18.24s -> 23.88s]  than a couple coffee cans of material, making the dust too sparse for us to see.
[23.88s -> 29.34s]  Or maybe the dust was much larger than normal, making it hard for us to detect.
[29.34s -> 30.00s]  I know that sounds.
3.transcript:
[0.00s -> 5.30s]  the outgassing can be seen because it ejects large amounts of dust which form a cloud
[5.30s -> 9.06s]  around the object called a coma and a tail.
[9.06s -> 13.76s]  But with Omuamua, no type of coma or tail is seen.
[13.76s -> 18.24s]  Maybe Omuamua doesn't have much dust left after its intercellar journey, an amount no more
[18.24s -> 23.88s]  than a couple coffee cans of material, making the dust too sparse for us to see.
[23.88s -> 29.34s]  Or maybe the dust was much larger than normal, making it hard for us to detect.
[29.34s -> 30.00s]  I know that sounds.

metadata.notes: The video features a woman in a red top standing against a cosmic background, discussing celestial objects such as comets and asteroids.

4.content:
Caption:
视频展示了一个人在宇宙背景前讲解天文现象，特别是关于尘埃和光线检测的讨论。她身穿红色上衣，配以深色背景和宇宙环形图案。随后出现了一个彩色光谱图，显示了不同波长的光谱，包括红外线、可见光和紫外线等。接着是宇宙星空中的一个物体的插图，强调其在不同波长下的观测难度。最后，视频回到了这位讲解者，继续讨论与Oumuamua相关的内容。
Transcript:
[0.00s -> 7.00s]  It sounds counterintuitive, but it's easy to detect dust when the particles are similar in size to the wavelength of light we're using.
[7.00s -> 13.00s]  Observatories we're looking at Omuamua Invisible Light, where we have the most sensitive detectors.
[13.00s -> 18.00s]  But larger particles of dust would be easier to detect with microwave or radio wavelengths.
[18.00s -> 21.00s]  This is definitely an unusual object.
[21.00s -> 29.00s]  And unfortunately, no more new observations of Omuamua are possible, because it's already too dim and far away for even Hubble to see.
[29.00s -> 30.00s]  see.
4.transcript:
[0.00s -> 7.00s]  It sounds counterintuitive, but it's easy to detect dust when the particles are similar in size to the wavelength of light we're using.
[7.00s -> 13.00s]  Observatories we're looking at Omuamua Invisible Light, where we have the most sensitive detectors.
[13.00s -> 18.00s]  But larger particles of dust would be easier to detect with microwave or radio wavelengths.
[18.00s -> 21.00s]  This is definitely an unusual object.
[21.00s -> 29.00s]  And unfortunately, no more new observations of Omuamua are possible, because it's already too dim and far away for even Hubble to see.
[29.00s -> 30.00s]  see.

metadata.chunk_summary: 视频展示了一个人在宇宙背景前讲解天文现象，特别是关于尘埃和光线检测的讨论。她身穿红色上衣，配以深色背景和宇宙环形图案。随后出现了一个彩色光谱图，显示了不同波长的光谱，包括红外线、可见光和紫外线等。接着是宇宙星空中的一个物体的插图，强调其在不同波长下的观测难度。最后，视频回到了这位讲解者，继续讨论与Oumuamua相关的内容。
metadata.notes: The video focuses on the detection of dust particles and celestial objects using different wavelengths.

5.content:
Caption:
视频开始时展示了一个宇宙场景，一颗彗星或小行星在星空背景下缓缓移动。接着出现一位女性站在宇宙背景前，似乎正在讲解相关内容。之后是NASA的标志和相关信息，鼓励观众访问NASA网站了解更多信息。
Transcript:
[0.00s -> 3.40s]  But when there's one weird object, there are probably more.
[4.20s -> 7.26s]  Sky survey programs will keep an eye out for other interstellar visitors,
[7.66s -> 11.36s]  and the Hubble Space Telescope will be ready to contribute observations
[11.36s -> 16.14s]  to better understand any more orphaned vagabonds traveling between the stars.
[30.00s -> 32.00s]  Thank you.
5.transcript:
[0.00s -> 3.40s]  But when there's one weird object, there are probably more.
[4.20s -> 7.26s]  Sky survey programs will keep an eye out for other interstellar visitors,
[7.66s -> 11.36s]  and the Hubble Space Telescope will be ready to contribute observations
[11.36s -> 16.14s]  to better understand any more orphaned vagabonds traveling between the stars.
[30.00s -> 32.00s]  Thank you.
